title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Join the Envision AESC Team!

We are currently hiring Maintenance Controls Technicians in our Smyrna, TN plant.

The Maintenance Controls Tech will get hands on experience working with Programmable Logic Controllers working in a clean, temperature controlled and highly technical mechanical facility.

What’s in it for YOU?

  • Hourly rate $28.14 to $34.82 (based on experience)
  • Night Shift Position (Mon-Thurs: 8pm – 6:30am with $1.20/hr shift premium
  • Hands on and in-depth experience working with PLCs daily
  • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
  • 401k with company match plus annual retirement contribution
  • Paid Vacation and 14 Paid Holidays
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • And much more!

What will you do in this role?

  • Train to be a Controls Engineer starting on Day 1!
  • Learn to read and interpret electrical and mechanical drawings and schematics describing PLC-based control systems
  • Upkeep, troubleshoot and repair mechanical, pneumatic and electronic subsystems on highly automated process lines and related equipment
  • Promote and support a safe work environment and safety-oriented culture by following all safety programs and guidelines

What does it take to be successful in this role?

  • Associates Degree in Machine Tool Technology, Mechatronics or related program preferred
  • 3-5 years of Industrial Maintenance experience OR 0-2 years of experience and a two-year technical degree, industrial maintenance certification or equivalent
  • Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC’s): Knowledge and ability to troubleshoot and modify/create programs is preferred (creating, editing and troubleshooting)

Learn more: https://vimeo.com/758796866/a4c3f3f2d5

Envision AESC is the world's leading battery technology company. Through AIoT-driven innovations in battery technology and multidisciplinary applications, Envision AESC establishes scenarios to enable electric vehicles to participate in the renewable energy eco-system and provides a dynamic balance to the common development of clean energy and new energy electric vehicle industry.

All of us at Envision AESC – regardless of functional area or expertise – share a passion to design, manufacture, and sell high-performance products. It is our policy to provide Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, gender, disability, or any other status protected by law. Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work in the United States and will be required to provide proof of employment eligibility at the time of hire.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $28.14 - $34.82 per hour

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • Overnight shift
  • Weekend availability

Application Question(s):

  • Do you have an Associates Degree in a related field (i.e. Mechatronics, Engineering, Industrial Maintenance) OR 3-5 years of on the job experience in an automated industrial facility?

Work Location: One location
educationRequired: Associates Degree in Mechatronics or Related Field

microCredentialsRequired.name: Level 1: Siemens Certified Mechatronics System Assistant

title: Project Manager
description:
Stamtec, Inc., a manufacturer of metal stamping and forming presses, is seeking a Project Manager/Engineer in the Sales/Projects Department. This is not a remote position. Project Manager must work from Stamtec in Manchester, TN, which is located about one hour from Nashville, ½ hour from Murfreesboro, and one hour from Chattanooga. Stamtec offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience and excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, and 401k profit sharing plan.

Desired Skills

  1. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Microsoft Project
  2. Well-developed writing skills
  3. Competence in reading, understanding, and working with engineering department on AutoCAD drawings and electrical schematics.
  4. Technical knowledge of mechanical metal-stamping presses or related industries, especially automotive and appliance
  5. Strong understanding of mechanical concepts and their applications.
  6. Familiarity with manufacturing processes, machinery, and equipment.
  7. Proactive mindset with ability to foresee potential risks and take preventive action to mitigate or avoid them.
  8. Confidence and determination to impose success in reaching critical project milestones while enhancing customer experience and maintaining project budget.
  9. High level of motivation & creativity to actualize solutions in fast-paced & dynamic situations.
  10. An Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, or Certification as a Professional Project Manager is strongly preferred

title: CMM Technician
description:
As part of a global community of talented people, you will grow and thrive working on advanced technologies for greener, safer and smarter mobility. Our company culture gives all our employees the opportunity every day to #Dare.Care.Share.

  • Preferred 2 year Associates Applied Science Degree minimum, Basic CMM certification, and other gage certifications
  • Experience with Ployworks a must, any CMM equipment example: FARO, CREAFORM, etc., along with gage calibration.
  • Knowlege in Engine Cooling background, preferably in the automotive industry.
  • Experience with Ployworks a must, any CMM equipment example: FARO, CREAFORM, etc., along with gage calibration.
  • Knowlege in Engine Cooling background, preferably in the automotive industry.
  • Program, operate, and perform maintenance on Coordinate Measuring Machine.
  • Develop and help maintain plant wide calibration systems according to QS 9000 and American Association of Laboratory Accreditation standards.
  • Participate in Design review meetings to recommend acceptable datum schemes for products.
  • Assist with development and training of CMM and Calibration Technicians.
experienceLevel: Knowlege in Engine Cooling background, preferably in the automotive industry.
educationRequired: Preferred 2 year Associates Applied Science Degree minimum, Basic CMM certification, and other gage certifications.
